item.title: Area is full of fallen leaves creating a slip/ fall hazard, 3rd December
item.description:
The whole of Rushmore Close requires cleaning as its full of wet dead fallen leafs from the nearby trees creating hazard conditions for pedestrian / cyclist / motorbike users from slip trip and fall.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushmore Close, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cricklewood Broadway, London

item.title: Fly tipped item, adjacant to dog waste bin on the green, 3rd December
item.description:
Fly tipped ironong board, sand bag and road sign reported on 09/10/2025. Ironing board was removed soon after reporting. Sand bag and road sign remain in situ. These were left behind by Trojan Energy who were working on behalf of Bexley Council to imstall EV charging points on the green at The Crescent. Please can Trojan Energy either come and collect them, or Bexley Council remove them. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verges and hedges full of litter, 3rd December
item.description:
The grass verge and hedges along Nelson Mandela Road, bordering Kidbrooke Playing fields are full of litter. The council staff only clear the pavement and don’t touch the litter in the hedges. This is unsightly and includes bottles of urine etc. a deep clean in is required, whether it’s street team or parks something needs to be done. Also raised with local councillor due to lack of action by RBG

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thyme Close, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disposal of stolen goods, 3rd December
item.description:
Between 4h44 and 4h51 am on December 3rd, what is believed to be a stolen vehucle drove past our house and disposed of the items in the pictures. We have footage of the vehicle. We have also managed to track down the owner of the disposed suitcase (details were in it) and the person has their car stolen in Streatham.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hitherwood Drive, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All of the subway and bridge lights are not working, 3rd December
item.description:
All of the subway and bridge lights are not working, making it very scary and difficult to traverse. Especially, as many dogs (and people) foul and urinate in the area. There is also a lot of broken glass around usually, so even in daylight this route is hazardous. Without any lights, its even worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Kidbrooke, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath pothole in pinch point, 3rd December
item.description:
The pot hole in the footpath that I previously reported that is still there and due to this I have damaged my wheelchair and injured my foot. When entering Russia Dock Woodlands from Archangel Street you are forced through pinch point barriers (which I think do not meet accessibility requirements and should be removed or updated.) In the middle of the barriers is a pothole. The front caster wheel of my wheelchair got stuck in this, spinning me around and causing me to crash into the barrier damaging my wheelchair and injuring my foot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lady Dock Walk, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant littering, 3rd December
item.description:
This has been reported on other occasions, it's sometimes resolved temporarily before starting again almost immediately. Overflowing wheely bins and litter left on the pavement outside no. 41 Horton Road, it seems to have become a near constant problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Horton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
